title: Emergency Active Travel Fund 2, Shoreham Street

content:
Dear Sheffield City Council,
Provide the following:
A. Any Road Safety Audits undertaken in relation to the Shoreham Street element of recent EATF2 works. Do not include the Cherry Street filter within this request.
B.  Any relevant internal emails discussing quoted safety issues on Shoreham Street, which have delayed building.
C. Any emails between Active Travel England/Department for Transport discussing the safety issues and delays to the above.
D. Any considered layout designs for the above, including the latest.
Yours faithfully,
Roy Martin

Dear Sheffield City Council FOI Officer,
Has this request been received?
Yours faithfully,
Roy Martin

Dear Roy Martin,
Thank you for your request for information relating to Emergency Active
Travel Fund 2, Shoreham Street which we received on 22/05/2023.
As your request is a request for information relating to the environment,
this has been logged as a request under the Environmental Information
Regulations 2004 (EIR) and will be dealt with under the Regulations. The
reference number for your request can be found above.
The Environmental Information Regulations 2004 state that we must respond
to you within 20 working days, by 20/06/2023, but we kindly ask for your
patience as we anticipate that there may be a delay in some cases. Please
do not hesitate to contact us at the email address below if you have any
queries.
Yours sincerely,
Sheffield City Council

Dear FOI,
The deadline of 8th of August approaches in just over a week.
A kind reminder, as the original request was 22nd of May, I can only presume there is a great deal of feet dragging in releasing this information.  Evidence suggest you will be requesting an extension of the deadline for an internal request. If you do wish to delay further, it would be appropriate to inform me in writing of the desire to once again extend the deadline.
"Please note that the Code of Practice does allow us to extend this
deadline by an additional 20 days in some situations. If we need more time
to complete the internal review, we will contact you to inform you of
this."
Yours sincerely,
Roy Martin

Good morning,
Happy 8th of August.
Do you wish to extend the deadline?
I will take a lack of response as a no and will be referring the case to the information commissioner at the end of this week.
Yours sincerely,
Roy

Dear FOI,
I am sure this will once more go un-responded.
In my other FOI you state:
"The Freedom of Information Code of Practice states that we should aim to
your request for internal review within 20 working days, by 08/08/2023.
Please do not hesitate to contact us at the email address below if you
have any queries.
Please note that the Code of Practice does allow us to extend this
deadline by an additional 20 days in some situations. If we need more time
to complete the internal review, we will contact you to inform you of
this."
It is unusual you have opted to quote 40 days as a starting point in this request.
Unlike my other request, you have stated your target as: "06/09/2023" for this information.
Before the summer holidays is quoted as an excuse, do consider the fact the request has made in May 2023 and it required the production of no new information, only sharing of drawings and emails in existence.
I offered in June 2023 "This request is overdue. It would be acceptable to receive A. Road Safety Audits and D. any considered designs, including latest, ahead of the more onerous task of evidencing emails around these issues."
I would consider a further extension if these documents are provided by the 2th of August.
As a starting point, a response would be polite, saying you are still working towards start of September.
Otherwise, I will be referring this to the ICO.
Yours sincerely,
Roy Martin

Hi Mr Martin
Apologies for our delay, we are replying this afternoon with the information.
Kind regards
Sheffield City Council

Dear Mr Martin
Thank you for your request for an internal review on 11 July 2023, and
apologies for missing our deadline of 8 August 2023. We acknowledge your
chasers of 8 and 11 August 2023. We accept your complaint about our
failure to respond to your original request of 22 May 2023 for information
about the Emergency Active Travel Fund 2, Shoreham Street. We breached
Regulation 5(2) of the Environmental Information Regulations 2004 which
requires a response within 20 working days. It was due on 20 June 2023. We
had the information available to send you on 27 June 2023. But it was
overlooked due to our workload. We sincerely apologise for this lapse on
our part and hope you have not been too inconvenienced by the delay.
Please find below our response to your request:
A. Any Road Safety Audits undertaken in relation to the Shoreham Street
element of recent EATF2 works. Do not include the Cherry Street filter
within this request.
We are happy to share the Road Safety Audit (RSA) once the response to it
has been signed off. The main issue in the corridor is getting cyclists
safely from the (proposed new) bi-directional cycling route on the (inside
the Ring Road) section of Shoreham Street across to Matilda Street, so
cyclists can continue towards the City centre. We are withholding the RSA
under the Environmental Information Regulations 2004, specifically
Regulation 12(4)(d) - Material in the course of completion, unfinished
documents, and incomplete data. The public interest in disclosure is
transparency. The public interest in withholding the Audit at this time is
that there is time for the information to be checked before it is made
public and that the timetable properly requires internal consideration of
the information prior to its public release. On balance, the Council
believes that the public interest lies in maintaining the exception. We’ll
advise you of the sign-off date as soon as we have it.
B.  Any relevant internal emails discussing quoted safety issues on
Shoreham Street, which have delayed building.
Our redacted emails are to follow.
C. Any emails between Active Travel England/Department for Transport
discussing the safety issues and delays to the above.
There have been no emails sent from Sheffield City Council to Active
Travel England/Department for Transport discussing the safety issues and
delays to the above
D. Any considered layout designs for the above, including the latest.
The RSA was based on the design shown below. No additional design work
will be undertaken until the response to the RSA has been signed off.
If you have any queries about this response, please do not hesitate to
contact us.
The information provided in this response is available for re-use under
the terms of the Open Government Licence v3.0. The terms of the OGL can be
found [1]here. When re-using the information, Sheffield City Council
requires you to include the following attribution statement: “Contains
public sector information obtained from Sheffield City Council and
licensed under the Open Government Licence v3.0.”
If you are unhappy with the response you have received in relation to your
request, you are entitled to have this reviewed. You can ask for an
internal review by replying to this email. Internal review requests should
be submitted within 40 working days from the date of this response.
If you remain dissatisfied with the outcome of your internal review, you
can contact the Information Commissioner’s Office. Please see
[2]
https://ico.org.uk/make-a-complaint/offi...
for further details.
Kind Regards,
Sheffield City Council
PO Box 1283
Sheffield, S1 1UJ

Dear FOI,
Thank you for this response my initial questions and request for an internal review.
Question A.
I requested the Road Safety Audit. This is a distinct and signed off document by a professional, than to your responses to said document, which is a different piece of work entirely.
Regulation 12(4)(d) does not apply to the completed RSA without responses.
B. Thank you, please provide a date when provision will take place, as you admit at the top of this response you have failed to meet all deadlines.
C. I'll accept this unlikely answer.
D. A signed off RSA means 12(4)(d) does not apply and you are able to share said document, without your responses.
I will give you time to reconsider your responses above.
I do not accept your proposal that I submit for a secondary internal review, as this was indeed, an interview review.
As you mentioned staff workloads, I will set a deadline of 25th August to provide the unresponded and yet full complete RSA. This is a resonable comprise for a document in existence.
After such time, I will have completed requirements needed to refer this to the Information Commissioner’s Office.
This is clearly a waste of time and resources and we would all like to avoid that outcome. In the meantime, I urge you to provide the unresponded, complete Road Safety Audit.
A precedent has been established that RSA without responses can be freely published in several other FOI requests.
https://www.whatdotheyknow.com/request/r...
Yours sincerely,
Roy Martin

Dear FOI,
Given the lack of response to the previous message, I will take this as your final response
To go back over old ground,
Question A. - Not provided
I requested the Road Safety Audit. This is a distinct and signed off document by a professional, than to your responses to said document, which is a different piece of work entirely.
Regulation 12(4)(d) does not apply to the completed RSA without responses.
B. Thank you, please provide a date when provision will take place, as you admit at the top of this response you have failed to meet all deadlines. - Not provided
C. Complete.
D. A signed off RSA means 12(4)(d) does not apply and you are able to share said document, without your responses. - Not provided
An acknowledgement to say this is your position would have been expected, given the vastly extended deadlines and patience from my side.
Yours sincerely,
Roy Martin

Dear Roy Martin,
Internal Review – Reference – EIR / 872212
Thank you for your email requesting an internal review into the response
Sheffield City Council provided to your EIR request. We endeavour to
provide a response to internal reviews within 40 working days. However, a
review can sometimes be delayed and I apologise for this.
I can now confirm that a full and impartial review of the decision made in
this case has been conducted with a summary as follows:
You contacted the council on 22^nd May 2023, requesting information
relating to Emergency Active Travel Fund 2, Shoreham Street. The response
that you received on the 11^th August 2023 provided answers to some of the
questions asked.
Your email received by the council on 15^th August 2023 explained that you
were requesting an internal review of the above response, particularly
relating to points a) and d).
I have reviewed the information disclosed (alongside your complaint) and
have determined that firstly, the Council is in breach of the appropriate
Code of Practice, which requires a response to an internal review within
40 days; and we have taken just over four months to reply. We sincerely
apologise for this, but we have had a significant backlog of requests that
is taking us a long time to get through.
In relation to the content of your request, please see the attached
information regarding the Road Safety Audit and the redacted emails as
requested. SCC can confirm that the design of the scheme is being reviewed
following the RSA.
Please note that personal data has been redacted under Regulation 12(3) of
the Environmental Information Regulations 2004 (EIR) and Regulation 13 EIR
as amended by Sch. 19, para 307 of the Data Protection Act 2018, which
provide an exception for where the information requested includes personal
data of which the applicant is not the data subject where disclosure would
contravene the data protection principles of the General Data Protection
Regulation (GDPR). Disclosure of the information would contravene the data
protection principle under Article 5(1)(a) of the General Data Protection
Regulation that processing of personal data must be fair, lawful and
transparent.
